commit_message:
Make block migration work with LVM backend

Change libvirt driver to not wrongly ignore lvm disks and to
return the correct disk type for lvm disks with correct size
so that migration destination can re-create the instance disks
in the right way.

Change-Id: I4a014f98f1a6627171334c038bb88a4eef70a55c
Closes-Bug: #1282643

commit_message:
Adds flavor.id metric

Simple metric for tracking of flavor changes over time for a given
instance.

Adds a pollster to update flavor on polling interval, and a
notification that updates on create, delete, and resize to have
accurate flavor data at any given point.

Adds tests for flavor id metric, and updates test notifications to
also have the "instance_flavor_id" value.

Metric added to docs.

Change-Id: I6d242330d088dc152b92e509265ececb8627dea2
Implements: blueprint flavor-id-metric

commit_message:
Include cisco plugin in migration plugins with ovs

Currently we have many migration files with missing cisco
plugin in migrate_plugin when ovs is included.This
causes missing tables when cisco plugin is enabled
and migration is run. This fix should automatically
include the cisco plugin if ovs is detected in the
migrate_plugins.

Change-Id: I4dedfbafe9b431e85255d5427766e22eed09ee5e
Closes-Bug: #1292114
(cherry-picked from f23d081b26071e1b309f49e5a5ab0cdc1a739e9d )

report_interval is how often an agent sends out a heartbeat to the
service. The Neutron service responds to these 'report_state' RPC
messages by updating the agent's heartbeat DB record.
The last heartbeat is then compared to the configured
agent_down_time to determine if the agent is up or down.
The agent's status is used when scheduling networks on DHCP
and L3 agents.

In the spirit of sane defaults suited for production, these values
should be bumped to reduce the load on the Neutron service
dramatically, freeing up CPU time to perform intensive operations.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/config.py

commit_message:
Change report_interval from 4 to 30, agent_down_time from 9 to 75

report_interval is how often an agent sends out a heartbeat to the
service. The Neutron service responds to these 'report_state' RPC
messages by updating the agent's heartbeat DB record.
The last heartbeat is then compared to the configured
agent_down_time to determine if the agent is up or down.
The agent's status is used when scheduling networks on DHCP
and L3 agents.

In the spirit of sane defaults suited for production, these values
should be bumped to reduce the load on the Neutron service
dramatically, freeing up CPU time to perform intensive operations.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1293083

(cherry picked from commit e13d19cab384a9f5f8a00436ad39118f342af32c)
Change-Id: I77bcf8f66f74ba55513c989caead1f96c92b9832
Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/common/config.py

commit_message:
Change repeater to retry on error

 * Retry is only attempted if task responds with error. Successful tasks do
not have to be retried which is the primary difference repeat and retry.

* Once a retry is triggered delay and break-on are taken into considertaion.
Modified tests appropriately and renamed types and properties appropriately.

Change-Id: I660cac05c20e791c0620add99d9d348f4bd910d1

commit_message:
Updates to the neutron install section

Update a few elements to try to make things clearer:
- turn the warning about commenting [service_providers] into a step to
  make sure that the user will do it.
- use a keystone command to compute the SERVICE_TENANT_ID value
  (RHEL/SUSE).
- simplify the 'ln -s' command to avoid changing directory.

Change-Id: Id76ba3a4ade0753522a4d49bdd4d8bcec8b56d62

commit_message:
Use cached db object in volume_mig_status ext

There is no need to rerequest the volume object from the db in
the extension because we already have a cached copy in the request.
This can potentially save hundreds of db queries in list.

Change-Id: I46da8c7b6c2af2435d246ebd8e95d4712065f1e7
Resolves-bug: 1308255

commit_message:
Improved quota error message

Removed two negatives and showed a clear message when
tried to see quota of different tenants.
When a user who does not belong to a project tries to access the
quota of that project, the message that gets displayed is not clear.
In this change the user would understand the error more properly.

Change-Id: I2284df07687bb530fe06fbaab38e2971826b7b40
Closes-Bug: #1288915

commit_message:
Nuage Plugin: Delete router requires precommit checks

There exist a case where deleting router from neutron without
deleting router-interface deletes router from VSD but not from neutron.
If router has an interface with subnet router deletion is not allowed.
Needs to precheck this condition before deleting router from
backend (VSD).

Change-Id: I4ba7eff399acda0427505328355dbfb931d62587
Closes-Bug: #1298635

from method signature. Method 'remove_user' was
removed because method 'add_user' is unused and if
we never do add_user then no reason to do remove_user.

subject: Make network_cache more robust with neutron
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-02 00:28:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': "Make network_cache more robust with neutron

Currently, nova treats neutron as the source of truth for which ports are
attached to an instance which is a false assumption. Because of this
if someone creates a port in neutron with a device_id that matches one
of their existing instance_ids that port will eventually show up in
nova list (through the periodic heal task).

This problem usually manifests it's self when nova-compute
calls to neutron to create a port and the request times out (though
the port is actually created in neutron). When this occurs the instance
can be rescheduled on another compute node which it will call out to
neutron again to create a port. In this case two ports will show
up in the network_cache table (since they have the same instance_id) though
only one port is attached to the instance.

This patch addresses this issue by only adding ports to network_cache
if nova successfully allocated the port (or it was passed in). This
way these ghost ports are avoided. A follow up patch will come later
that garbage collects these ports.

Closes-bug: #1258620
Closes-bug: #1272195

Conflicts:

	nova/network/neutronv2/api.py

Change-Id: I961c224d95291727c8614174de07805a0d0a9e46
(cherry picked from commit 46922068ac167f492dd303efb359d0c649d69118)
"}]
commit_message:
Make network_cache more robust with neutron

Currently, nova treats neutron as the source of truth for which ports are
attached to an instance which is a false assumption. Because of this
if someone creates a port in neutron with a device_id that matches one
of their existing instance_ids that port will eventually show up in
nova list (through the periodic heal task).

This problem usually manifests it's self when nova-compute
calls to neutron to create a port and the request times out (though
the port is actually created in neutron). When this occurs the instance
can be rescheduled on another compute node which it will call out to
neutron again to create a port. In this case two ports will show
up in the network_cache table (since they have the same instance_id) though
only one port is attached to the instance.

This patch addresses this issue by only adding ports to network_cache
if nova successfully allocated the port (or it was passed in). This
way these ghost ports are avoided. A follow up patch will come later
that garbage collects these ports.

Closes-bug: #1258620
Closes-bug: #1272195

Conflicts:

	nova/network/neutronv2/api.py

Change-Id: I961c224d95291727c8614174de07805a0d0a9e46
(cherry picked from commit 46922068ac167f492dd303efb359d0c649d69118)

commit_message:
Rename instance_actions v3 plugin tests to server_actions

* Renames the os-instance_actions v3 plugin tests to os-server-actions
* Also modifies JSON v3 client to use os-server-actions
* Skip get_server_actions and list_server_actions json tests
* This is required because changing name of v3 ext os-instance-actions
* to os-server-actions.

Closes-Bug: #1206032

DocImpact

Required-By: Id5049e10f5ef540d0d8e3871d800e9d9cb33da73

Change-Id: Ia493d4838dee4a8a587d12a55f16afeb143d959d

This syncs Keystone with oslo-incubator commit hash
2fd457bf2ccbeb2b84ffb204778b6417cd5405ba .

 $ rm -r keystone/openstack/common

In oslo-incubator:

 $ python update.py ../keystone

The newer lockutils requires posix_ipc. It's already in
global-requirements.

shouldn't rely on that.

removed from openstack-common.conf. log_handler is available in
the oslo.messaging library.

Change-Id: I6082f4e0995ca35372f9b061d8f76890aa93250c
"}]
commit_message:
Sync with oslo-incubator 2fd457b

This syncs Keystone with oslo-incubator commit hash
2fd457bf2ccbeb2b84ffb204778b6417cd5405ba .

In keystone:

 $ rm -r keystone/openstack/common

In oslo-incubator:

 $ python update.py ../keystone

The newer lockutils requires posix_ipc. It's already in
global-requirements.

Keystone uses gettextutils and versionutils from oslo-incubator
so those should be in openstack-common.conf. They were pulled in
as dependencies of other oslo-incubator modules but Keystone
shouldn't rely on that.

Keystone doesn't use log_handler directly so that module was
removed from openstack-common.conf. log_handler is available in
the oslo.messaging library.

Change-Id: I6082f4e0995ca35372f9b061d8f76890aa93250c

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-15 15:38:46.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_multithreading.py', 'swiftclient/multithreading.py'], 'message': "Fix test_multithreading on Python 3

* On Python 3, the printer doesn't encode Unicode to utf8 anymore, since
  print() expects a Unicode string.

* Update unit tests for Python 3 since repr() doesn't escape non-ASCII
  characters in Unicode strings anymore:
  http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3138/

Change-Id: I89471019d691a46651312d6a49964b719192148a
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test_multithreading on Python 3

* On Python 3, the printer doesn't encode Unicode to utf8 anymore, since
  print() expects a Unicode string.

* Update unit tests for Python 3 since repr() doesn't escape non-ASCII
  characters in Unicode strings anymore:
  http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3138/

Change-Id: I89471019d691a46651312d6a49964b719192148a

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-11 15:33:05.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/messaging/_drivers/impl_qpid.py'], 'message': 'Update ensure()/reconnect() to catch MessagingError

The error handling code that gets connections reset if necessary
caught ConnectionError.  It really needs to catch MessagingError,
which ConnectionError inherits from.  There are other types of
MessagingErrors that may occur, such as InternalError, and they need
to cause the connection to reset, as well.

Closes-bug: #1303890
Change-Id: Ic5082b74a362ded8b35cbc75cf178fe6e0db62d0
(cherry picked from commit bb6f3f11f3d65e104faa8dc4ee1b880d0c6394a4)
'}]
commit_message:
Update ensure()/reconnect() to catch MessagingError

The error handling code that gets connections reset if necessary
caught ConnectionError.  It really needs to catch MessagingError,
which ConnectionError inherits from.  There are other types of
MessagingErrors that may occur, such as InternalError, and they need
to cause the connection to reset, as well.

Closes-bug: #1303890
Change-Id: Ic5082b74a362ded8b35cbc75cf178fe6e0db62d0
(cherry picked from commit bb6f3f11f3d65e104faa8dc4ee1b880d0c6394a4)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 12:32:21.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Upgrade requirements to alembic

in ceilometer, currently the alembic>=0.4.1, in between 0.4.2 release and
0.5 release, the argument name in 'drop_constraint' and 'create_index' methods
changed from tablename to table_name. it best to upgrade the requirements to
alembic >= 0.5.

Change-Id: I3f81b17d0b39fa7a956920fc374009f40474dd92
Closes-bug: #1267284
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade requirements to alembic

in ceilometer, currently the alembic>=0.4.1, in between 0.4.2 release and
0.5 release, the argument name in 'drop_constraint' and 'create_index' methods
changed from tablename to table_name. it best to upgrade the requirements to
alembic >= 0.5.

Change-Id: I3f81b17d0b39fa7a956920fc374009f40474dd92
Closes-bug: #1267284

and having it here too is both confusing and may break builds

commit_message:
Install Guide edits

section_keystone-services.xml:
  Use "OpenStack Identity" instead of "OpenStack Identity Service" for
  service creation
section_neutron-ml2-network-node.xml:
  Explain that 10.0.1.21 is the instance tunnels network address of
  the network node.
  Give a better warning that two steps are done on the controller
  node.
section_neutron-ml2-compute-node.xml:
   Explain that 10.0.1.31 is the instance tunnels network address of
   the first compute node.

Change-Id: I57d311fd0413d8a8a13f4746465612096b302e0c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4468, 'name': 'Wangpan', 'email': 'hzwangpan@corp.netease.com', 'username': 'hzwangpan'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8001, 'name': 'John Warren', 'email': 'jswarren@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jswarren'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-12 03:01:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Don't cache base image while migration

We should cache base image only if the disk file of instance is
not exists. while migration the disk is an whole one without
backing file even if it is qcow2 format, so nova needn't to
cache base image for instance, otherwise if the Glance image
is deleted, an ImageNotFound exception will be raised.
Here we also add target image exists checking after getting the
lock, otherwise we may get a broken image.

Closes-bug: #1298216
Closes-bug: #1298420
Change-Id: Icfbc03239e3aa55948942c33d37ca39ffcf471c4
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Don't cache base image while migration

We should cache base image only if the disk file of instance is
not exists. while migration the disk is an whole one without
backing file even if it is qcow2 format, so nova needn't to
cache base image for instance, otherwise if the Glance image
is deleted, an ImageNotFound exception will be raised.
Here we also add target image exists checking after getting the
lock, otherwise we may get a broken image.

Closes-bug: #1298216
Closes-bug: #1298420
Change-Id: Icfbc03239e3aa55948942c33d37ca39ffcf471c4

subject: move cleaner context users/admin into setup()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-15 19:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['tests/benchmark/context/test_cleaner.py', 'rally/benchmark/context/cleaner.py'], 'message': 'move cleaner context users/admin into setup()

In chain of calling context method, cleaner.users are set in __init__
before user context setup which cause cleaner.users is always empty. As
a result _cleanup_users_resources is never called.

Change-Id: I2e381cae67a47123f5e2c2fc876d965136ded9df
Closes-bug: #1308188
'}]
commit_message:
move cleaner context users/admin into setup()

In chain of calling context method, cleaner.users are set in __init__
before user context setup which cause cleaner.users is always empty. As
a result _cleanup_users_resources is never called.

Change-Id: I2e381cae67a47123f5e2c2fc876d965136ded9df
Closes-bug: #1308188

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-15 23:14:31.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/api.py', 'nova/tests/network/test_api.py'], 'message': 'Make _is_multi_host() use objects

This makes the network api _is_multi_host() method use objects
instead of direct database access so that compute manager can
call it directly.

Note that the previous unit tests for this method used the
random.choice() method to selectively test the is/is-not multihost
case. Unit tests should not be non-deterministic like this, for
coverage and stability reasons. This patch pulls out the two
possibilities for each into separate cases to ensure both are
tested.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I432a759a666948f2cfaa29d82f749dc9a39141be
'}]
commit_message:
Make _is_multi_host() use objects

This makes the network api _is_multi_host() method use objects
instead of direct database access so that compute manager can
call it directly.

Note that the previous unit tests for this method used the
random.choice() method to selectively test the is/is-not multihost
case. Unit tests should not be non-deterministic like this, for
coverage and stability reasons. This patch pulls out the two
possibilities for each into separate cases to ensure both are
tested.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects-juno

Change-Id: I432a759a666948f2cfaa29d82f749dc9a39141be

commit_message:
Disable oslo.messaging debug logs

oslo.messaging debug logs are too verbose, turn them off. A similar patch
dropped nova-conductor logs in the gate down from 7MB to under 300K.

Cherry-Pick from oslo-incubator since we are in feature freeze:
Ia12c003dae196e2220a5f6ea768758a75f2ede23 and
Icc61964c6a2b002ac1c8566f174e6a5230674c75

Change-Id: I9e6456f1c979d9a57fc7fa93fb290c6a26017373

subject: Fixes HP LeftHand driver with Paramiko 1.13.0
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-09 15:46:55.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_lefthand_cliq_proxy.py', 'cinder/tests/test_hplefthand.py'], 'message': 'Fixes HP LeftHand driver with Paramiko 1.13.0

With Paramiko 1.13.0, the method exec_command now returns Unicode.
This causes a problem when the driver tries to build the XML returned
from the LeftHand array. The XML header returned from the array defines
the encoding as encoding=UTF-8. Therefore, we must now ensure the
encoding passed to the parser is utf-8.

Change-Id: I7b504626e2d9a0ee2b62820b11f56eb136e31987
closes-bug: #1298608
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes HP LeftHand driver with Paramiko 1.13.0

With Paramiko 1.13.0, the method exec_command now returns Unicode.
This causes a problem when the driver tries to build the XML returned
from the LeftHand array. The XML header returned from the array defines
the encoding as encoding=UTF-8. Therefore, we must now ensure the
encoding passed to the parser is utf-8.

Change-Id: I7b504626e2d9a0ee2b62820b11f56eb136e31987
closes-bug: #1298608

commit_message:
Fix swiftclient.client.quote() for Python 3

On Python 3, urllib.parse.quote() accepts bytes and str (unicode) types and
always return str (unicode).

Add also more tests with non-ASCII characters.

Change-Id: I8e0f19da7240e874392327d0da074ed4abb7d213

commit_message:
Update ensure()/reconnect() to catch MessagingError

The error handling code that gets connections reset if necessary
caught ConnectionError. It really needs to catch MessagingError,
which ConnectionError inherits from. There are other types of
MessagingErrors that may occur, such as InternalError, and they need
to cause the connection to reset, as well.

This fix has already been merged into oslo.messaging.

--

Cherry-picked from master 9a830b370551019a4bd3a0c7504f48961e755bd4
Cherry-picked from oslo-incubator 234f64d608266f43d8856ff98c89ceba6699d752
See also https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1086077

Change-Id: Ic5082b74a362ded8b35cbc75cf178fe6e0db62d0
Closes-bug: #1303890

commit_message:
Enable flake8 H303,H304 checking

We had two types of wildcard imports in the code. Unneeded ones
in test files that are just removed, and some that we actually
want which are kept using the '#noqa' comment to tell flake8
to skip specific checks (such as H303) for that line.

Change-Id: I7d194a7bbcccdba419a2a49a919e17c047633cf0

commit_message:
Add support for multiple RPC workers under Metaplugin

Metaplugin needs a fix to support multiple RPC workers properly
because a plugin which supports multiple RPC workers cannot
initialize RPC connections at plugin initialization.

Closes-Bug: #1300570
Change-Id: I584f70abb8969054cd4edc8f914d00f6be930bab

subject: Refactor the driver fields mapping
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-15 09:44:53.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/nova/virt/ironic/ironic_driver_fields.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/test_patcher.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'ironic/nova/virt/ironic/patcher.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/test_driver.py', 'ironic/nova/tests/virt/ironic/utils.py'], 'message': "Refactor the driver fields mapping

Refactor the driver fields mapping into classes, the idea is to have one
class per driver type (pxe, seamicro, agent, etc...). The old mapping was
hard to extend, for e.g in case of converting one of the values before
sending the request to Ironic wasn't possible (swap_mb -> swap_gb).

This patch also minimize the number of requests sent to the Ironic API
when adding/cleaning up the nodes attributes, instead of sending 1
request per attribute it will condense everything in one request to
avoid bombarding the API service.

Change-Id: Ibfd0a8051dc84740b42c2ad46dbdbe1ed00cbdf1
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor the driver fields mapping

Refactor the driver fields mapping into classes, the idea is to have one
class per driver type (pxe, seamicro, agent, etc...). The old mapping was
hard to extend, for e.g in case of converting one of the values before
sending the request to Ironic wasn't possible (swap_mb -> swap_gb).

This patch also minimize the number of requests sent to the Ironic API
when adding/cleaning up the nodes attributes, instead of sending 1
request per attribute it will condense everything in one request to
avoid bombarding the API service.

Change-Id: Ibfd0a8051dc84740b42c2ad46dbdbe1ed00cbdf1

subject: Rename HTTPError -> HttpError
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-14 23:41:13.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/exceptions.py', 'keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py', 'keystoneclient/session.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/apiclient/__init__.py'], 'message': "Rename HTTPError -> HttpError

With the move to the apiclient exceptions from oslo the basic HTTP error
class was renamed. This was not reflected in all places in the code.

It was also not picked up by the tests because the apiclient tests
weren't running due to a missing __init__.py file. Because this should
be backwards compatible it was added to the list in exceptions, the
check that this is available is in the (now running) apiclient tests.

Blueprint: common-client-library-2
Change-Id: I307c1083f29e3207cc86aa938043270e5c32b4bb
"}]
commit_message:
Rename HTTPError -> HttpError

With the move to the apiclient exceptions from oslo the basic HTTP error
class was renamed. This was not reflected in all places in the code.

It was also not picked up by the tests because the apiclient tests
weren't running due to a missing __init__.py file. Because this should
be backwards compatible it was added to the list in exceptions, the
check that this is available is in the (now running) apiclient tests.

Blueprint: common-client-library-2
Change-Id: I307c1083f29e3207cc86aa938043270e5c32b4bb

 1. Use inetd instead of nc on backends.

commit_message:
Improve test_load_balancer_basic

This patch introduces multiple improvements of test_load_balancer_basic.

 1. Use inetd instead of nc on backends.
    Running nc in a while True cycle proved to be ineffective
    and unreliable in case of a relatively big number of
    requests.
 2. Add doc string to NeutronRetriever.
 3. Add setUp method and cleanups for resources
    as a preparation for adding more tests.
 4. Other minor fixes of storing internal values.

Change-Id: I8b5426c9cc832cb8bb5024952535f312cd627d1e

As part of setting up gate jobs for stevedore, we have turned on
a doc build gate job. That job is failing because it can't install
Pillow. Nothing else uses Pillow, and it is not a runtime dependency

Change-Id: I96c80ce571bae71ef1b867b0c4f60572fa9a4c5c

commit_message:
Add Pillow for stevedore doc build

As part of setting up gate jobs for stevedore, we have turned on
a doc build gate job. That job is failing because it can't install
Pillow. Nothing else uses Pillow, and it is not a runtime dependency
of stevedore.

Change-Id: I96c80ce571bae71ef1b867b0c4f60572fa9a4c5c

commit_message:
Up the default timeout for stack builds

This commit ups the default stack build timeout from 600 to 1200.
The stack frequently can take longer than 600 secs to build so
doubling it should give us a safe margin.

Related-Bug: #1297560

Change-Id: I3b13a225793d42e2fa9f4871b2fe81c745954c56

On assembly create, solum will generate a trigger_uri which needs to
be returned to the user. The user will then add this uri to his/her
git repo as a webhook. When a git push is done on this repo, a POST

Change-Id: I4add3d10634f7ab4d41af948bde0bc2747d00dde

commit_message:
Return 'trigger_uri' on assembly create and show

On assembly create, solum will generate a trigger_uri which needs to
be returned to the user. The user will then add this uri to his/her
git repo as a webhook. When a git push is done on this repo, a POST
request will be sent to the trigger_uri which will then start the
build and deploy workflow.

Change-Id: I4add3d10634f7ab4d41af948bde0bc2747d00dde

commit_message:
Don't encode as UTF8 under python3

Since this is already on UTF8 and if we do it would just get converted
as bytes and fails.

Change-Id: Ibde2914e45fcc5d1bc74eebb7241f92037e0cd8c

commit_message:
Add ability to configure any catalog driver

Add a catalog_driver parameter which can be used to bypass
the catalog_type parameter and offer finer control over
the catalog driver configuration in Keystone.

Conflicts:
  manifests/init.pp

Closes-bug: #1301592
Change-Id: If062c855c875cf06e192593181898ba0a185a91a
(cherry picked from commit cc0150532c5bc5e6498609132cc97ced3d20985b)

commit_message:
Add functional tests to verify ovs_lib VXLAN detection

This commit adds a functional test to verify host VXLAN support. It compares
the results of this functional test with the logic in ovs_lib to ensure both
report the same values.

Closes-Bug: #1301101

Change-Id: Id91c755d762bea134cc451952d0f13d64576663a

subject: Avoid using too generic names in _Namespace
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-15 00:38:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo/config/cfg.py'], 'message': 'Avoid using too generic names in _Namespace

As _Namespace is used to hold key-values for user options,
avoid using conflict-prone names for internal purposes.
Namely, prefix ours with '_'.

For example, consider the following.

    conf.register_cli_opt(cfg.BoolOpt('parser'))

In this case, the option would get added to the namespace
object as a "parser" attribute, which would conflict with
the existing name in the object.

Change-Id: Ibaf8408a118e07a8a598f87ac10a91312683df40
Closes-Bug: #1284969
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid using too generic names in _Namespace

As _Namespace is used to hold key-values for user options,
avoid using conflict-prone names for internal purposes.
Namely, prefix ours with '_'.

For example, consider the following.

    conf.register_cli_opt(cfg.BoolOpt('parser'))

In this case, the option would get added to the namespace
object as a "parser" attribute, which would conflict with
the existing name in the object.

Change-Id: Ibaf8408a118e07a8a598f87ac10a91312683df40
Closes-Bug: #1284969
